channel.title: Science Magazine Podcast
channel.description: Periodic audiocasts from Science Magazine, the world's leading journal of original scientific research, global news, and commentary. For a full archive of shows, please visit www.sciencemag.org/multimedia/podcast.
channel.copyright: © 2012 American Association for the Advancement of Science
channel.itunes:subtitle: Science Magazine Podcast
channel.itunes:author: Science Magazine
channel.itunes:summary: Periodic audiocasts from Science Magazine, the world's leading journal of original scientific research, global news, and commentary. For a full archive of shows, please visit www.sciencemag.org/multimedia/podcast.

item.title: Science Podcast - Quantum computers, motion after paralysis, astronomical mysteries, and more (1 June 2012)
item.description: How quantum computers may someday help simulate quantum field theories; restoration of voluntary motion after spinal cord injury; big mysteries in astronomy; and more.

item.itunes:subtitle: How quantum computers may someday help simulate quantum field theories; restoration of voluntary motion after spinal cord injury; big mysteries in astronomy; and more.
item.itunes:summary: How quantum computers may someday help simulate quantum field theories; restoration of voluntary motion after spinal cord injury; big mysteries in astronomy; and more.
item.itunes:keywords: Science, Science Magazine, quantum computers, quantum field theories, qubit, spinal cord injury, paralysis, rehabilitation, sun, corona, solar system, dark energy, astronomy
